topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54deae6b636872461d1e0700#post_54deae6b636872461d1e0700
The only thing I remember is _bon bon_, which means candy in French. Yeah, why do they even teach French as part of the mandatory curriculum in areas of Canada outside of Quebec where French is very rarely used? Unless you wish to go into certain professions such as multinational entrepreneurialism, and politics here, I don't see the need.

In fact, more people speak Chinese where I live.
